DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Glomerular Filtration Rate Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of a kidney function test that measures fluid volume filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

Concepts.definition: A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

PermissibleValues.value: Greater than or equal to 50 ml/min
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To Fifty Milliliter per Minute

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Fifty Milliliter per Minute
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than Fifty Milliliter per Minute

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than Fifty Milliliter per Minute
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.: A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than forty-nine and less than fifty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
